metadata.title: CVE-2016-1951 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in io/prprf.c in Mozilla Netscape PortableRuntime (NSPR) before 4.12 allow remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via along string to a PR_*printf function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnspr4 - 2:4.12-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnspr4-0d - 2:4.12-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
nspr package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.12-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
